intro: Diodia foliosa, commonly known as broadleaf diodia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along streambanks. Diodia foliosa is known for its aromatic foliage and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
